page.title: 20The School Organisation
page.content: The school normally provides education for children within the age groups 7-11.Classes are organised wherever possible on an age basis in mixed ability groups. The pastoral care of the pupils is normally undertaken by the class teacher concerned. Any special needs of boys and girls due to physical or emotional development are the concern of appropriate senior members,male and female,of the school staff. Friendly and caring relationships with the children are developed by the teachers on the basis of their professional position"in loco parentis"and discipline is normally enforced by sanctions or withdrawal of privileges. When any pupil's behaviour causes concern,parents are invited to visit the school to discuss problems.
